channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12688] Update site with a bootstrap-based UI
item.description: Looks like we can "upgrade" our look pretty cheaply by just swapping to a different skin. This fluido-skin uses Twitter Bootstrap. It's an older 2.x version (upstream has moved onto 3.x), but it's a start. There's some out-of-the-box configuration choices regarding menu bar location. We can also look into some of our own custom CSS.
item.summary: Update site with a bootstrap-based UI

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

This message is automatically generated.

I tried it locally. Its great. +1. Maybe use the file:///Users/stack/checkouts/hbase.git.commit/target/site/images/jumping-orca_rotated_12percent.png instead of the 25percenter because its size is taking up too much of the banner. Also, have you dropped our little search box? Excellent. How were you brave enough to purge the site.vm? No more velocity templating going on? That's a blessing really (but this is probably how you lost the search box). Commit and we can refine after. You know how to build site? If not, say, and I can do it for you post-commit.
Looks better. +1.

I think velocity templating is still happening under the hood, it's just being done from fluido's default site.vm file. We can bring it back, if you'd like to keep that bit explicit. I hadn't noticed the loss of the search box; I'm prone to start with fluido's version because it's known working with the new css/js, and then apply anything it's missing (like the search box).

There's another one, reflow-maven-skin, which looks like it's getting more updates than fluido. Looks more feature-full too, makes it easy to drop in themese Was pointed out to me by one yohan.koehler@gmail.com. Let me give this one a spin.

Similar patch, this time using the new reflow-maven-skin. I like this one a lot better; it's much more clear how to use it and how we can customize it going forward. As an added bonus, I have it setup to use the Journal bootswatch theme. Not sure how to make it grab the red (what I wanted) for the header bar, make it match our color palate.

Also using the smaller orca image as per stack's suggestion.
Nick, can you please attach the index.html file from this.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12687340/HBASE-12688.00-reflow.patch

I've been playing with reflow over in htrace and have had a good experience. Agree, better doc., and that it looks better.
Hi, I've been looking for reflow too and it offers lot's of useful features, theme switching, built-in components like carousel or sidebars, better choice I think.
For those interested, here's the results: http://people.apache.org/~ndimiduk/site/

Suggest choosing a style that is more plain, 'spacelab', or 'flatly'. I think if you let version and published go left, the gray bar under them will get fatter and fit them better (least I had same problem over on http://htrace.incubator.apache.org/ where I followed your lead here and letting them go left seemed to 'fix' the background thing). We can figure how to get the search back later. Looks great.

Uses reflow, takes stack's comments into account, uses 'spacelab' theme. Brings back the old 25px logo because I think it looks better.

Updated what's here: http://people.apache.org/~ndimiduk/site/
Pushed to master. Thanks for the opinions everyone.
You know how to push site or you want me to do it Nick Dimiduk?

Will spin it by hand tomorrow unless you're itching to push it.
I'm asking Misty Stanley-Jones to do it.... Fancy new suit... need to get it up there (smile)
Live. Looks gorgeous!!
Yeah, it really looks good now, even on mobile it's pretty clean.
Looks great!!
Thanks Misty Stanley-Jones!

yohan koehler now that the groundwork has been established, would you like to play around with some designs? I didn't like this theme because it's highlight color is blue, and we're more of a red kind of project

....and we're more of a red kind of project

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_orange to be exact, the 'engineering' hue – see HBASE-5115 (though I thought 'engineering' the golden gate bridge color, it seems like wikipedia has since added a new variant that is the GG).

Oh yes I will make some test with different colors, bootstrap has a theme builder. It seems like the book doesn't get the bootstrap css, I don't know how it is generated but maybe you can supply your own stylesheet from a cdn, it will be interesting to have the same stylesheet for the Home and the Book, the test I've sent you few days ago just included the boostrap css and I find it more readable than the actual one (which is indeed better than the old one without style )
